benchmark_details.name: EasyMath
benchmark_details.overview: EasyMath is a compact benchmark for practical math reasoning in small language models, covering thirteen categories from basic arithmetic to word problems, and assessing models' everyday math skills in a zero-shot setting.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the real-world mathematical reasoning capabilities of small language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark focuses on small language models and does not assess multilingual performance or reasoning over non-text modalities.

data.source: Questions and solutions were manually created to ensure quality and relevance.

methodology.calculation: Responses are checked for exact, symbolic, or numerical equivalence to the correct answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better practical performance in everyday mathematical problem solving.
methodology.validation: Evaluation methods ensure robustness across diverse mathematical problem types.
